alert.note: Alert for Haskell; McIntosh; Muskogee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 3:25PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WEST CENTRAL HASKELL... NORTHEASTERN MCINTOSH AND SOUTH CENTRAL MUSKOGEE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM CDT... At 325 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 5 miles southeast of Checotah, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Checotah... Onapa... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 263 and 276. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for southeastern and east central Oklahoma.
